official-title.#text:
To authorize the Administrator of General Services to convey a parcel of real property in
			 Albuquerque, New Mexico, to the Amy Biehl High School Foundation.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the
sponsor.#text: Ms. Michelle Lujan Grisham of New Mexico

cosponsor.#text: Mr. Ben Ray Luján of New Mexico

action-desc.#text:
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the
			 Union, and ordered to be printed

action-instruction.#text: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on February 5, 2014

action-desc.#text:
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the
			 Union, and ordered to be printed

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

quote.#tail:
means the real property, including any improvements thereon, located in Albuquerque, New Mexico,
			 that, as determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, subject to survey, generally
			 consists of lots 12 through 19, and for the westerly boundary, the portion
			 of either lot 19 or 20 which is the outside west wall of the basement
			 level of the Old Post Office building, and which has a municipal address
			 of 123 Fourth Street, SW., in Block 18, New Mexico Town Company’s Original
			 Townsite, Albuquerque, New Mexico.

quote.#tail: means the Amy Biehl High School Foundation.

header.#text: Conveyance of real property in Albuquerque, New Mexico, to the Amy Biehl High School Foundation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall offer to convey to the Foundation, by
			 quitclaim deed, all right, title, and interest of the United States in and
			 to the Federal land.

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of
			 this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014/s:3/ss:a

shall
			 require the Foundation to pay to the

consideration in an
			 amount equal to the fair market value of the Federal land, as determined
			 based on an appraisal that is acceptable to the

text.#text: As consideration for conveyance of the Federal land under
The Foundation shall be responsible for paying—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014/s:3/ss:b

text.#text: the costs of an appraisal conducted under
any other costs relating to the conveyance of the Federal land under this Act.

shall be paid into the Federal Buildings Fund
			 established under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014/s:3/ss:b
Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014/s:3/ss:d/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, in amounts specified in appropriations Acts, for
			 expenditure for any lawful purpose consistent with existing authorities
			 granted to the

text.#text: Amounts paid into the Federal Buildings Fund under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may require that any conveyance under

be subject to such
			 additional terms and conditions as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014/s:3/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
considers appropriate
			 to protect the interests of the United States.

text.#text:
The conveyance of the Federal land under this Act shall occur not later than 3 years after the date
			 of enactment of this Act.
